predictions.text: The FOMC will leave the federal funds target range unchanged at its January 2026 meeting (decision announced by 2026-01-29).
predictions.verification_criteria: Federal Reserve press release for the January 2026 FOMC meeting shows the target range is unchanged versus the prior meeting.
evidence: Market focus on the imminent Fed decision and guidance amid a weakening dollar (CNBC, 2026-01-27).
monitoring_signals: CME FedWatch implied probabilities for the January meeting
Fed communications/blackout-period leaks (if any)
Overnight index swaps pricing into 2026-01-29
predictions.rationale: With inflation uncertainty and a sudden USD move, the committee is more likely to wait for additional data than to surprise with a near-term hike/cut.

predictions.text: ICE U.S. Dollar Index (DXY) will close below 95.00 on at least one trading day by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Historical market data for ICE DXY shows at least one daily close < 95.00 between 2026-01-28 and 2026-03-31 inclusive (UTC).
evidence: USD hit a four-year low and suffered its worst one-day slide since April (CNBC, 2026-01-27).
monitoring_signals: Fed statement/dot-plot and press conference tone
U.S. CPI/PCE surprises and real-rate moves
G10 risk sentiment and positioning (CFTC, bank flow notes)
predictions.rationale: Recent downside momentum raises tail risk of another leg lower, but the 95 handle is a meaningful threshold and may attract policy/market stabilization.

predictions.text: A partial-year high in U.S. home-purchase contract cancellations will be recorded: Redfin will report a national pending-sales cancellation rate of at least 17.0% for any 4-week period ending by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Redfin’s publicly released weekly housing report shows cancellation rate >= 17.0% for any reported 4-week period with end date on or before 2026-04-30.
evidence: Homebuyers are backing out at the fastest pace in nearly a decade, indicating affordability strain (CNBC, 2026-01-27).
monitoring_signals: Mortgage-rate levels (Freddie Mac PMMS)
Pending home sales and mortgage purchase applications
Redfin weekly cancellation and price-cut metrics
predictions.rationale: Affordability stress and rate volatility often show up quickly in cancellations; 17% is high but plausible if financing costs remain elevated.

predictions.text: A standalone DHS funding stopgap will be enacted: a DHS-only continuing resolution or appropriations law will be signed by the U.S. President by 2026-02-07 (UTC), explicitly funding DHS past its then-current expiration date.
predictions.verification_criteria: Congress.gov and/or White House signing statement confirms enactment of a law (CR/appropriations) that explicitly provides budget authority for DHS beyond the prior DHS funding deadline.
evidence: U.S. government nears partial shutdown risk over DHS funding (CNBC, 2026-01-27).
monitoring_signals: House/Senate floor scheduling for DHS funding vehicles
Statements from leadership and appropriations chairs
OMB/Speaker letters signaling shutdown timelines
predictions.rationale: When shutdown risk is localized to one department, Congress often passes a narrow stopgap to buy time even amid broader fiscal conflict.

predictions.text: At least one set of articles of impeachment targeting U.S. DHS Secretary Kristi Noem will be formally introduced in the U.S. House by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Congress.gov (or official House Clerk records) shows a resolution introducing articles of impeachment against Kristi Noem submitted by a House member on or before 2026-03-31.
evidence: Immigration enforcement backlash includes Democratic impeachment threats against DHS Secretary Noem (CNBC, 2026-01-27).
monitoring_signals: Public statements from House Democratic leadership and key committees
Filing activity by members already signaling impeachment
Escalations in immigration enforcement court actions/protests
predictions.rationale: Public threats increase the chance of an introduction even if passage is unlikely; introductions can be driven by caucus signaling rather than majority support.

predictions.text: Vineyard Wind (or its owner/operator) will publicly confirm resumption of offshore turbine installation or offshore construction activities at the Martha’s Vineyard-area project by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Company press release, BOEM notice, or credible trade press quoting the developer confirms offshore construction restart (e.g., turbine installation, foundation installation, cable-lay) by 2026-06-30.
evidence: Judge revived an offshore wind project previously halted, suggesting legal resilience for the project (NYT, 2026-01-27).
monitoring_signals: BOEM/USACE permitting updates and court docket entries
AIS vessel tracking for installation/cable vessels in the lease area
Developer procurement/port activity announcements
predictions.rationale: Legal revival is a necessary step, but weather windows, vessel availability, and financing/permitting constraints make timing uncertain.

predictions.text: Anthropic will publicly announce a new equity financing round totaling at least $3.0 billion (USD) in disclosed proceeds (single round), by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Anthropic (or lead investors) publicly announces a funding round with disclosed raised amount >= $3.0B, or SEC Form D filings and major outlets corroborate amount >= $3.0B by 2026-06-30.
evidence: AI infrastructure/investment accelerating; Anthropic fundraising reportedly pushed toward ~$20B valuation (CNBC, 2026-01-27).
monitoring_signals: Form D filings and investor announcements
Large-cloud partnership updates and compute/offtake deals
Secondary-market pricing and credible funding leaks
predictions.rationale: Compute-intensive scaling and competition for frontier models support large rounds, but terms and timing depend on market risk appetite and strategic investor participation.

predictions.text: At least two of the following Linux distributions will publish advisories confirming patched packages for OpenSSL addressing CVE-2025-15467 by 2026-02-29 (UTC): {Ubuntu, Debian, Red Hat, SUSE, Amazon Linux}.
predictions.verification_criteria: Security advisory pages for at least two listed distributions explicitly reference CVE-2025-15467 and indicate a fixed/updated OpenSSL package released by 2026-02-29.
evidence: OpenSSL disclosed a CMS parsing stack buffer overflow (CVE-2025-15467), highlighting widespread exposure (OpenSSL advisory, referenced 2026-01-27 summary).
monitoring_signals: Distro security mailing lists (USN, DSA, RHSA, etc.)
NVD enrichment and vendor statement updates
Downstream package repository updates (apt/yum/zypper)
predictions.rationale: OpenSSL issues typically receive rapid downstream patching by major distros, especially for memory-corruption bugs with broad dependency footprints.

predictions.text: Humana will publicly revise (downward) its full-year 2026 revenue guidance by at least 2.0% versus its most recently issued 2026 revenue guidance, in an earnings release/call or filed investor presentation, by 2026-05-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Compare Humana’s latest stated 2026 revenue guidance prior to 2026-01-28 with a later guidance figure; verification requires a downward change of >=2.0% disclosed by 2026-05-15 in official investor materials.
evidence: Health insurers sold off after UnitedHealth guided to 2026 revenue decline, pressuring peers and suggesting sector headwinds (MarketWatch, 2026-01-27).
monitoring_signals: Humana earnings dates and guidance language changes
CMS payment/risk-adjustment updates and peer read-throughs
Medical cost trend disclosures and utilization metrics
predictions.rationale: UnitedHealth’s warning can foreshadow broader MA/managed-care pressure, but Humana’s membership mix and pricing actions could offset, keeping probability modest.
